text.div:
Id: DT.IMMZ.D2.DT.Seasonalinfluenza
Url: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Version: 0.2.0
Title: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Status: draft
Date: 2025-07-17 20:56:23+0000
Publisher: WHO
Description:

Determine required vaccinations
Knowledge Capability: computable
Related Artifacts:

References

  • Vaccines against influenza: WHO position paper (May 2022) (28)


  • WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)
Libraries:
DTs.Seasonalinfluenza
Actions:
Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination: Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" Influenza vaccines are safe and effective in children from 6 months of age. Children aged under 6 months can be protected through maternal immunization during pregnancy.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with first seasonal influenza dose as client's age is less than 6 months. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for first dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination: Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" Children aged 6 months to 8 years should receive 2 doses at least 4 weeks apart. A single dose is appropriate for those ≥ 9 years of age and healthy adults.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with first seasonal influenza dose as no seasonal infuenza doses were administered and client is within appropriate age range. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination: Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" Children aged 6 months to 8 years should receive 2 doses at least 4 weeks apart.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with second seasonal influenza dose as latest seasonal influenza dose was administered less than 4 weeks ago. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the second dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination: Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with second seasonal influenza dose as client is within appropriate age range and latest seasonal influenza dose was administerered more than 4 weeks ago. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose: The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE A single dose is appropriate for children aged ≥ 9 years and healthy adults. Those who have previously been vaccinated at least once should subsequently receive an annual dose, as should children and adolescents aged 9 years or over and healthy adults.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with annual dose as the latest seasonal influenza dose was administered less than 1 year ago. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the next dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
The primary series is complete. Client is due for seasonal influenza annual dose: The primary series is complete. Client is due for seasonal influenza annual dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output The primary series is complete. Client is due for seasonal influenza annual dose
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)

Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:

priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose

priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

Client is due for seasonal influenza annual dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE

relatedArtifact.citation: Vaccines against influenza: WHO position paper (May 2022) (28)
WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)

action.title: Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination
action.description:
Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

Influenza vaccines are safe and effective in children from 6 months of age. Children aged under 6 months can be protected through maternal immunization during pregnancy.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with first seasonal influenza dose as client's age is less than 6 months. 
Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for first dose.

action.title: Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination
action.description:
Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"

Children aged 6 months to 8 years should receive 2 doses at least 4 weeks apart. A single dose is appropriate for those ≥ 9 years of age and healthy adults.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with first seasonal influenza dose as no seasonal infuenza doses were administered and client is within appropriate age range. 
Check for contraindications.

action.title: Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination
action.description:
Client is not due for seasonal influenza vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

Children aged 6 months to 8 years should receive 2 doses at least 4 weeks apart.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with second seasonal influenza dose as latest seasonal influenza dose was administered less than 4 weeks ago. 
Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the second dose.

action.title: Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination
action.description:
Client is due for seasonal influenza vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with second seasonal influenza dose as client is within appropriate age range and latest seasonal influenza dose was administerered more than 4 weeks ago.
Check for contraindications.

action.title: The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose
action.description:
The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
"Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE

A single dose is appropriate for children aged ≥ 9 years and healthy adults. Those who have previously been vaccinated at least once should subsequently receive an annual dose, as should children and adolescents aged 9 years or over and healthy adults.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with annual dose as the latest seasonal influenza dose was administered less than 1 year ago. 
Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the next dose.

action.title: The primary series is complete. Client is due for seasonal influenza annual dose
action.description:
The primary series is complete. Client is due for seasonal influenza annual dose
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"
"Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with annual dose as the latest seasonal influenza dose was administered more than 1 year ago. 
Check for contraindications.

action.title: The primary series is complete. Client is not due for seasonal influenza annual dose
action.description:

"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
"Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE

action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:

Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the next dose.

action.description:

"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"
"Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Seasonal influenza vaccines") = TRUE

expression.expression:
